comments:
Hi,

        I have updated birt 2.2 runtime files. 

OS - linux
webserver - Tomcat

I try to run birt report files, report files are created by eclipse 3.2 version.

Eclipse SDK
Version: 3.2.0
Build id: I20060602-1317

I am getting this error like below

org.eclipse.birt.report.engine.api.EngineException: Some required parameter values are not set or set to incompatible data type.

Note :

        This problem occurs only report which contains scalar parameter.


can you suggest me if I missed anything.

Regards
Ennigo
It seems that you defined some parameter in the report design but don't set the value in runTask.

Hi wei yan,

       The same report is working on BIRT 2.1 series. even I tried with sample report from birt runtime folder ie test1.rptdesign, its giving same error.

-ennigo

can you attach the report design?

thanks.

I have tested your report design in both 2.2 release and 2.2.1 daily build 2007-09-20, it generates the report successfully.

There are two parameters in your report design, one is string type, not null, not blank, default to "test", the other is decimal type, default to 12.0. If you need set the value for those parameters, notice that parameter value should be String and Number.

You can run that report without any parameter setting as both of them has default values.

For the sample report, as the parameter has no default value, so it must be set before running, otherwise the exception will be thrown out.

You need ensure that the parameters are setting correct before running it. If there still exits problems, please try to download the latest build and re-try.

As it works in my build, so I set it works for me.

thanks.

Hi,

1)   I have found another probelm in Birt 2.2, I have parameter with string type, not null,not blank, default to "ask", when I ran the report , it will disappears from UI.

2) i have set default value as null in same parameter, it throws runtime exception

can you suggest me if I miss anything.

Regards
Ennigo

If it is disappeared from the UI, the most possible reason is it is set to hidden. can you check your report design to see if the parameter is "hidden"?

As you has declare that the string parameter value to NOT NULL, NOT BLANK, you can't set the default value to NULL. You can either remove the NOT NULL/NOT BLANK or change the default value to not NULL.

thanks.

traces.message: Some required parameter values are not set or set to incompatible data type.
